column1: As demonstrated, ww_area_of_applicability() natively accepts variable importance scores
returned by the vip package (Greenwell and Boehmke 2020). The importance argument will

column2: also accept any data frame with columns named term and estimate, containing (respectively)
the variable name and importance estimate, allowing the use of any method for calculating
custom class “ww_area_of_applicability” which inherits from the “hardhat_model” and
“hardhat_scalar” classes from the hardhat package. This class can be thought of as being
for calculating DI and AOA for new observations. This function returns a tibble with two
columns: di, containing DI values for each new observation, and aoa, a boolean indicating
if the observation is within (TRUE) or outside of (FALSE) the AOA:
